# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(text::AbstractString; text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(text)
    lines = [""]
    
    for word in words
        if length(lines[end]) + length(word) + 1 > text_width
            push!(lines, word)
        else
            lines[end] = lines[end] * " " * word
        end
    end
    
    return join(lines, "\n")
end

# Example usage
text = "This is an example of wrapping a long string into multiple lines."
wrapped_text = wrap_string(text, text_width=20)
println(wrapped_text)
```

```
lines.
```
